instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2533: What is 820-2533? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: I hate ebay boards
threads.message:
None of my suppliers had an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a board in stock so i was stuck taking my chances on ebay. went through three of "pulled from a working laptop" before i found one that was halfway decent.

L4502 was burned/corded (not sure which) to hell and pad 2 was gone. Replaced and ran trace. I installed the os and gave it to customer telling him i couldn't check it (he was in a huge hurry and didn't want to wait for me to run asd)

laptop was brought back to me with Ethernet, 1 USB , Display Port and firewire not working. I looked over the board in a little more detail and found. 

<CHIP>U9480</CHIP> was missing and <CAPACITOR>C9416</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C9412</CAPACITOR> broken/missing. Replaced all three.  This fixed everything but thunderbolt/display port and Ethernet .   Ran ASD and it passes

Problem is that Ethernet is found in os, but it wont connect to router. i don't even get green light on the router that its plugged in.

threads.title: I hate ebay boards
threads.message:
Bad transformer or broken traces from connector to transformer. Don't buy boards on Ebay, or if you must just file a not as described claim. You decided to fix so now you own it..
I would never fix a 2533 machine if the original board was FUBAR, just too old now.

threads.title: I hate ebay boards
threads.message: when customer wants to spend 375$ to replace its worth a little time :)
